trans-unit.source: Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> object from one data type to another.

The PointConverter class is typically used for creating a design-time experience for controls that have properties that are of type <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit>, and is used to convert points to strings for display in a designer and to convert strings entered in a designer to a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit> object.
Access this class through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.PointConverter"></xref> class.
Determines if this converter can convert an object in the given source type to the native type of the converter.
A formatter context.
This object can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The type you want to convert from.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this object can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
The `context` parameter can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This can be `null`, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object can also return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> object that represents the type you want to convert to.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Converts the specified object to a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> object.
A formatter context.
This object can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
An object that contains culture specific information, such as the language, calendar, and cultural conventions associated with a specific culture.
It is based on the RFC 1766 standard.
The object to convert.
The converted object.
The conversion cannot be completed.
Converts the specified object to the specified type.
The most common types to convert are to and from a string object.
The default implementation calls the object's <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> method if the object is valid and if the destination type is string.
If this method cannot convert to the destination type, this will throw a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception.
A formatter context.
This object can be used to get additional information about the environment this converter is being called from.
This may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, so you should always check.
Also, properties on the context object may also return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
An object that contains culture specific information, such as the language, calendar, and cultural conventions associated with a specific culture.
It is based on the RFC 1766 standard.
The object to convert.
The type to convert the object to.
The converted object.
The conversion cannot be completed.
Creates an instance of this type given a set of property values for the object.
CreateInstance is useful for objects that are immutable but still want to provide changeable properties.
A type descriptor through which additional context can be provided.
A dictionary of new property values.
The dictionary contains a series of name-value pairs, one for each property returned from <xref:System.Drawing.PointConverter.GetProperties*>.
The newly created object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object could not be created.
The default implementation returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Determines if changing a value on this object should require a call to <xref:System.Drawing.PointConverter.CreateInstance*> to create a new value.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> through which additional context can be provided.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Drawing.PointConverter.CreateInstance*> method should be called when a change is made to one or more properties of this object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Retrieves the set of properties for this type.
By default, a type does not return any properties.
A simple implementation of this method can just call <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A> for the correct data type.
A type descriptor through which additional context can be provided.
The value of the object to get the properties for.
An array of <xref:System.Attribute> objects that describe the properties.
The set of properties that are exposed for this data type.
If no properties are exposed, this method might return <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The default implementation always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Determines if this object supports properties.
By default, this is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> through which additional context can be provided.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref:System.Drawing.PointConverter.GetProperties*> should be called to find the properties of this object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
